attributes.action: Change the name of the new GCSE's, as they are harder and worth more.
attributes.background: Recently GCSE's have been changed to make them more challenging for students. They have been made to prepare the students more for a levels, and we believe that this will be more challenging to get a good grade. The name 'GCSE' should be changed to something different.
attributes.additional_details:
Students now have to memorise there anthology (18 poems) in English.
Formulae have been removed from the Mathematics and Science GCSEs. So that must be memorised too.
Coursework has been replaced by full examinations. 
The content of the Mathematics GCSE has been expanded to cover A-Level topics.

attributes.action: Give a fine to parents if their children are persistent bullies.
attributes.background: I am asking for this petition to be signed so parents realise if they do not prevent their children from bullying other children persistently they would face a fine.
attributes.additional_details: As an aunty to my niece, who was bullied on many occasions, mainly from the same girl, I'm sure I speak for many parents who have found it devastating to watch someone go through this ordeal. This not only affects them, it actually changes them as a person. So would really be greatful for this to come into effect.

attributes.action: Ban the production and selling of mink lashes!
attributes.background: Mink eyelashes are a growing trend,but these animals are put through a huge amount of pain just for there fur. The animals are kept in confind cages and factory's. None of this is humane. All for humans to look "nice" while these animals have no say if people can use there fur,and through pain.
attributes.additional_details: No use of animal fur is humane.

attributes.action: Ban hospitals from charging for parking in England
attributes.background:
Scotland and Wales do not charge for parking at their NHS hospitals.  Why do England charge us to park for essential visits to hospital?
People are being charged extortionate amounts to access healthcare when they have already paid taxes and National Insurance.
attributes.additional_details:
As an ex NHS nurse, I remember when hospital car parks were free.  I can also remember, that when charges came into force, I had to claim the money back from the NHS when I was visiting a patient!
My local hospital Trust has collected over £4m in car parking charges over the last year.  I am sure this money goes over and above the required amount to operate the car parks.  Scotland and Wales provide free car parking. There is a definate disparity in fairness and policy.
WHY?

attributes.action: Change Just in Case medication policy to Debbiebox a NHS Standard practice in GP
attributes.background: My mum spent 4 hour dying in pain due to MAR chart missing. Ambulance Crew couldn't give drugs needed. My mum died hospital 1hr pain free. I had to watch her. Just in Case box is NOT standard practice. We want a Debbiebox in place in every GP with MAR, DNS and drugs and comes direct from GP.
attributes.additional_details:
The MAR charts was not requested at my GP and was missed out.  District nurse request a JUST IN CASE BOX. This GP didn't have a box policy.

The Debbiebox is a palliative care box which will have telephone numbers, drugs, MAR chart and DNR form, syringes it will be done by a GP alone.

Currently each GP has their own policy it should be standard practice so no miscommunication happens resulting in mistakes and someone dying in pain. 
This would stop compensation claims and is cost effective.

attributes.action: Establish legal presumption of shared, 50:50, care after parents' break up
attributes.background:
The adversarial character of family legal system is not fit for purpose.
The bias of legal professionals ( lawers, social workers, caffcass officers, family centres staff, judges) is causing more harm then good . Simple initial presumption of 50 :50 child care split will give power back to parents
attributes.additional_details:
In Sweden approximately40% of separated parents share care 50:50 and it is higher amongst younger children.
In the majority of cases the minimum of shared parenting is 30%
Just 2% of disputes are resolved in court

attributes.action: Create an impartial ombudsman to put PIP mandatory service levels in place
attributes.background: The DWP want to cut costs, but the costs are rising due to disabled people having to have claim reviewed and then appealed. A high number of cases are overturned at appeal meaning PIP is paid plus the administration of reviewing a case which should have been awarded in the first place.
attributes.additional_details:
pip sucess rate new claimants 47%
pip sucess rate DLA to PIP migrations 74%
pip sucess rate average overall 60.5 % (before tribunals)
pip failure rate 39.5%
65% of claimants will go to tribunal 

The ombudsman should be able to put statutory service levels in place to protect disabled people and the DWP against failures of quality made by 3rd party contractors such as atos and capita

attributes.action: Enforce disabled access in the UK rather than ignoring the issue
attributes.background:
Too many businesses in the UK do not have disabled access or even staff that are trained about the equality act and making reasonable adjustments.

Its time the UK took action to make disabled access mandatory in all businesses and for those who fail to be fined by their local authority.
attributes.additional_details:
Too many businesses in the UK do not have disabled access or even staff that are trained about the equality act and making reasonable 
adjustments for disabled people to have equal access to their services.

Its time councils had the power to issue fines, warnings and even court action against businesses that fail to comply with disability access law. Too little is being done to enforce this and a good number of disabled people do not have the energy to take these issues through court.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to sell tickets for more than 25% the face value!
attributes.background:
So today I tried to buy Red Hot Chilli Pepper tickets but at exactly 10am there were no tickets available. I was directed to ticketmasters sister site 'getmein' where the tickets were over 50% the original face value. 
We want to support the band, we do not want to support the touts!

attributes.action: Let merchants choose to trade using Imperial and/or Metric measurements.
attributes.background: EU law requires UK merchants to display weights and measures in metric units. Simultaneous display of Imperial units is allowed as an afterthought. Per Brexit, Parliament should enact a law allowing merchants to choose to display weights and measures in either Imperial or Metric units, or jointly.

attributes.action: The GCSE curriculum should be changed back to the previous curriculum.
attributes.background: This is unjustifiable and stressful for adolescents .Students from ages 15-16 years old are being made to do a much harder GCSEs in Maths and English. What was considered a C back then is now a 'lower C'. Why did the previous students get to do easier GCSEs?
attributes.additional_details: Young Secondary School children are being forced into another ridiculous and unreasonable new GCSE system. It is atrocious that children from the previous year had controlled assessments in English and this years dont. The government have added more higher grades and less lower grades (9-1) which is aggravating and overwhelming for most students who want to get into collage to do A levels, putting pupils under pressure, which is very unhealthy.

attributes.action: Vote of no confidence in the PM for failure to condemn US stance on refugees.
attributes.background: Theresa May has allied herself to President Trump bringing the UK into disrepute. We want a chance to show our displeasure by asking parliament for a vote of no confidence, triggering a general election

attributes.action: Stop agencies fining those who cannot attend work because of an emergency
attributes.background: Agencies are currently able to issue fines to workers if they do not give 48 hours prior notice that they are unable to attend a shift. If they have an emergency or illness in that 48 hour window they will be fined, whether or not they provide a reason.
attributes.additional_details:
One agency that does this is ROTA, which provides hospitality staff. Given that it is illegal to handle food within 48 hours of diarrhoea or vommiting you could effectively be fined for abiding by the law. 

It is outrageous to fine some of the lowest paid in our society. They already give up a lot of rights by having to take zero hour contracts, and to fine those in the most precarious of employment is deplorable.

attributes.action: Introduce Politics and Citizenship to the core UK school curriculum
attributes.background: In light of the recent Brexit and US presidential election, we strongly believe that all students should understand the nature of politics and their role and responsibilities as citizens and voters.

attributes.action: Where a partner dies before Retirement Age,transfer pension to Partner,for 5yrs
attributes.background: As part of the social care package I would propose that all persons whose life companion, partner, spouse, Husband or Wife died before that reached the stipulated Retirement Age to receive their partners pension, non-means-tested, for a period of Five years after the date of the loved one.
attributes.additional_details: This would also ease the burden on social care and health and be a clear signal of a Steadfast commitment to tackle the crisis of pensioner poverty, social care, and relive the impossible burden upon our NHS

attributes.action: Replace House of Lords with an elected house with advisory functions only.
attributes.background: The newly elected house would consist of a total of 100 representatives holding elections at the same time as a general election.  This would make the second house fully accountable to the electorate.  This would prevent the second house from subverting the will of the UK electorate.

attributes.action: Give the local authority the power to direct academy schools to take a child.
attributes.background: Our 8 year old son with additional needs suffered sustained & violent bullying from a child over 4 years culminating in a significant mental health breakdown. The school can not & will not deal with the bullying. We now cannot get our son into a new school.
attributes.additional_details: Our son was removed from school to safeguard him as the school we were moving him to had conceded an appeal to take him meaning only out of school for 2 weeks, only for the new school to then rescind the offer, two further schools will now not accept him, all three sighting they require an educational health care plan to review first. No agency appears to be interested to grip this, EFA have sent it back to the local authority who have no authority over academies. 106 days out of education now.

attributes.action: Allow all emergency services to use spit hoods!
attributes.background: Several infectious diseases are contained in saliva, I wish this subject to be discussed in Parliament and come down on the side of all emergency services.

attributes.action: End the ban on the creation of new grammar schools
attributes.background: Planned expansions of existing grammar schools will not be enough to address educational inequality; bright children who live nowhere near to a potential expanded grammar school are being failed.  The ban on the creation of new grammar schools must be repealed.
attributes.additional_details:
Your postcode should not determine your quality of education. Yet the gulf between the worst and best state schools is large and for many, private school is not an option. This has created severe educational inequality, which academic selection will help to address.

Grammar schools should be a top priority in improving opportunities for bright, poorer students. The government should allow the creation of new grammar schools to widen access to a rigorous, traditional and academic education.

attributes.action: Introduce Government subsidies on public transport for full time students.
attributes.background: Studying in full time education can cost families a sufficient amount of money each year on transport to school and recreational activities which they may not have. This can cost families and students thousands of pounds every year which they can spend on other costs in the household like books.
attributes.additional_details: For a bus ticket from Seaton to Exeter it costs a student £10 for a return trip which the money can be used for a text book from school.Therefore  the government should subsidie public transport for students in full time education.

attributes.action: All income used by self funders to pay for care needs should not be taxed.
attributes.background: Phase Two of the Care Act 2014 has been delayed, resulting in self funders having to finance care needs until their assets, including the value of the family home, fall below £23,500.  The Act included a cap on the maximum fees that could be paid. Tax relief on income for this purpose would be fair.
attributes.additional_details:
The Government Care Act Fact Sheets state: 

"These reforms aim to give everyone the peace of mind that they will be protected from catastrophic care costs by means of a cap on care costs." 

Also "The cap will limit the amount people have to pay towards the cost of their eligible care and support over their lifetime."

Delay in implementation does not protect people receiving care “from catastrophic care costs by means of a cap”.

attributes.action: Demand easy re-registration of British-registered vehicles in other EU countries
attributes.background: British citizens re-registering their vehicles abroad (in the EU) are experienced serious and costly administrative obstruction, or being refused. Vehicles presented in EU states with accompanying V5C that states the vehicle's EC Type Approval Number should be allowed easy and low-cost registration.
attributes.additional_details:
A core principle of the EU is freedom of movement of citizens and labour. Migrating citizens' vehicles should be easy to re-register in EU states if the registrant presents an EC Type Approval Number as printed on the UK V5C. This number proves EU-wide road conformity for the vehicle.

This is supported by  EC directive 2007/C68/04 which states that a vehicle already registered in a member state should not be tested again on the same criteria at re-registration or have to undergo further tests.

attributes.action: Waive the Police charges for the return of stolen vehicles to victims
attributes.background: Like many people I was recently the victim of motorcycle theft,  the police recently found the vehicle and told me it was subject to a £40 a day holding charge.  This is nothing but shameful profiteering on a victims loss from the Metroploitan Police a their policy should be changed.

attributes.action: Abolish TV Licencing and Increase National Insurance
attributes.background:
The NHS is funded by N. I. which is proportional to earnings.
The BBC is funded by a Licence Fee which costs a minimum of £145 a year.

People are being forced to pay for a non-essential service while an essential one is in dire need of extra funding. 

We must cut off the BBC to save the NHS.
attributes.additional_details:
How much the BBC demand:
https://www.tvlicensing.co.uk/pay-for-your-tv-licence/payment-methods/direct-debit-pay1

How much the NHS needs: 
https://www.theguardian.com/society/2016/may/20/nhs-in-england-reveals-245bn-record-deficit

How much the BBC gets:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/annualreport/2014/executive/finances/licence_fee.html

attributes.action: I propose a referendum to Ban the Burqa in public to be set into UK law
attributes.background: Due to governments once again not listening to the people who elect them I propose you hold a referendum to ban the burqa in all public spaces.  Let the people decide the fate / destiny of our country rather than politically correct politicians worried about being re-elected.
attributes.additional_details: https://yougov.co.uk/news/2016/08/31/majority-public-backs-burka-ban/

attributes.action: Transfer SouthEastern and Southern services to TfL from 2018 onwards
attributes.background: This petition demands that management and accountability for London's failing Metro services is handed over to TfL and operated under London Overground. Starting with 2018 SouthEastern services to and from Dartford followed by Southern services and others as and when current franchises expire.
attributes.additional_details: Chris Grayling MP has rejected the Mayor of London's proposal to allow TfL to take full control over the failing Southern and SouthEastern franchises when they expire. The London Overground unit has a proven track record of improving punctuality, cleanliness, staffing levels and frequency. Profits are reinvested into the network meaning that services are run for the benefit of passengers. Chris Grayling made a mess of our prisons - we need to stop him doing the same to our transport.

attributes.action: Please give extra money to keep our Isle of Wight acute inpatient hospital open.
attributes.background: Hampshire and Isle of Wight Sustainability and Transformation Plan [HIOW STP] has been published. The plan is to reduce overall running costs in the area. But we might lose 300 hospital beds. Acutely ill Isle of Wight patients need inpatient facilities near to home, not "ferried to the mainland".
attributes.additional_details: https://onthewight.com/petitions-protect-health-services-on-the-isle-of-wight-gaining-support/

attributes.action: Ban plastic staws or introduce a 5p charge for each one.
attributes.background: To help cut down on the amount of single use disposable plastics. As whether they are put in the bin or thrown on the floor the toxic chemicals still leak into our oceans and damage/kill marine life.

attributes.action: Debate the implementation of a carbon tax in the House of Commons
attributes.background:
Climate change is currently happening and economic experts cite a carbon tax as a solid and progressive step. Reducing carbon consumption and also taxation needed from other sources. 

Carbon tax would drastically reduce the rates of income tax. More money for you and a better environment.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.carbontax.org/why-a-carbon-tax/

'A robust tax on carbon pollution will create powerful incentives inducing policy-makers and individuals to reduce carbon emissions through conservation, substitution and innovation' 

'Currently, the prices of electricity, gasoline and other fuels reflect little or none of the long-term costs from climate change or even the near-term health costs of burning fossil fuels'

attributes.action: Leave the clocks on British Summer Time all year round.
attributes.background: Light evenings in the summer are widely enjoyed but it is a little depressing when the hours of daylight begin to shorten. Then there is the sudden jolt of even earlier darkness when the clocks go back one hour. Why not leave the clocks alone and allow gradual acceptance of the shorter days?
attributes.additional_details: It has been done before (1968 to 1971) and it has been debated many times. With the UK leaving the EU there will be no European requirement for a common summer time but, in effect, summer time would not be changed anyway. If businesses wish to keep in step with their international partners it should be easy enough for them to change their trading hours to suit; a side-effect of this could be to stagger business hours thus reducing rush-hour congestion and pollution. In areas such as northern Scotland where all-year BST would mean a mid-morning sunrise in the winter months surely it is not beyond the wit of men and women to adjust working hours as appropriate. Alternatively they could learn to live with it as do millions of people in other northern locations.

attributes.action: Urgently ban the use of preventative antibiotics in animal agriculture.
attributes.background: Antibiotics used in agriculture are a serious the threat to human health. Overuse is driving up levels of antibiotic resistance, leading to new superbugs. There must be a total ban on "preventative antibiotic use" where animals are given the drugs to prevent infection or speed up their growth.
attributes.additional_details:
This ban should also cover imported meat where antibiotics have been used. In many countries throughout the world animals use more antibiotics than humans. 

The use of antibiotics in farming represents a critical threat to public health. If antibiotics stop working, which is a distinct possibility, the outcome could be apocalyptic for humanity. We would go back to the days where a small cut or infection could be fatal.

No new antibiotics have been discovered since 1987.

attributes.action: Require the final Brexit deal with the EU to be approved by the UK Parliament
attributes.background:
The formal process of negotiating the exit of the UK from the EU includes 'consent' by MEPs in the European Parliament to the final deal. MPs in the UK Parliament should be afforded the same right as well.
If the UK Parliament fails to consent to the final Brexit deal, the UK should stay in the EU.
attributes.additional_details:
The Constitutional Reform and Governance Act 2010 details requirements around International Treaties being put before Parliament, prior to ratification.  The Government has yet to confirm its intention in this regard in respect of the final Brexit deal with the EU. (This is despite repeated requests for clarification by the Select Committee for Exiting the EU).

The UK Parliament is sovereign and its endorsement of the final Brexit deal should be required before ratification and implementation.

attributes.action: Ensure fracking is not allowed near Sherwood Forest
attributes.background:
Following a Guardian article (see link below) we would like to ensure that Ineos and any other company is not allowed to begin fracking near the historic site of the Major Oak in Sherwood Forest. 

(https://www.theguardian.com/business/2017/jan/01/robin-hoods-sherwood-forest-faces-fracking-threat)

attributes.action: Abolish employment tribunal fees.
attributes.background: We call on the Conservative Government to abolish tribunal fees which were introduced in 2013 which are severely hindering access to justice especially for those who are vulnerable.

attributes.action: Save the NHS by creating a new law to commit 11% of U.K. GDP on Healthcare
attributes.background:
The NHS is in difficulties. With a growing ageing population we need a strong healthcare system. The U.K. Spends less as a proportion of GDP than many other neighbouring countries. 
Let's stop political parties using the NHS as a political tool. Let's all agree to spend 11% of  GDP  regardless.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.kingsfund.org.uk/projects/nhs-in-a-nutshell/health-care-spending-com

attributes.action: Emotional Assistance Pet Act Urgently Needed.
attributes.background:
To grant the right for people in rented accommodation, who are struggling with emotional distress, depression - to keep a pet regardless of any “No Pet Clause”.

[According to Mental Health Foundation research, major depression is thought to be the second leading cause of disability worldwide.]
attributes.additional_details: The highest rates of suicides are associated with depressive disorder. More than, 6,00 suicides occur in the UK and Ireland each year. Due to the housing crisis we become "generation rent". The Mental Health Foundation research confirms value of "pet therapy" in suicide prevention and treating depression leading to it. It is scientifically confirmed that human-animal emotional bonds are equal to mother-child one, that no one would dare to question.

attributes.action: Stop prescribing medicines such as Paracetamol on the NHS!
attributes.background: The NHS spent £87.6 million pounds last year on paracetamol tablets which can be bought 20 times cheaper in a supermarket. Doctors wrote 22.9 million prescriptions at an average cost of £3.83. These painkillers can be bought in supermarkets for as little as 19p!!!!
attributes.additional_details: Let us all do out bit and let us help the NHS put its funding to better use. Lets stop prescribing medicines for common colds which can be bought so cheaply and freely in any supermarket or corner shop!

attributes.action: Establish an independent department to ensure truthful politics
attributes.background: In a year where the Oxford English Dictionary names its Word of the Year as 'post-truth', then something has gone wrong in the politics & campaigning world. This is a petition asking for the establishing of an independent department that will ensure truthful politics.
attributes.additional_details: We had the infamous claim that if we leave the EU, instead of sending £350 million a week to them, we can send it to the NHS; and then after the result declaring that we didn't actually send the EU that much money, & also it wouldn't be going directly to the NHS. This new independent department should consist of teams from Ofcom,Advertising Agency,CPS,ONS and electoral lawyers (etc) to ensure that no politician can mislead the public with unsubstantiated claims and that UK politics are truthful.

attributes.action: Empower the Police to seize and destroy Mobile Phones
attributes.background: So many people are killed or injured every week as a result of road traffic accidents where mobile phone distraction is the cause. Please sign & support this petition. you will be saving lives!

attributes.action: Make smear tests accessible at the age of consent, as opposed to at aged 25.
attributes.background: The legal national age for consent is 16. Smear tests aren't available until the age of 25. Meaning that any given woman could go for up to 9 years, without being screened for abnormal and dangerous cells.
attributes.additional_details: HPV, for example is contracted through sexual activity and is a leading cause for cervical cancer. Regardless of age, anyone can contract HPV and although it is now immunised for in most teenage girls, many women have no idea of the damage it causes before it's too late. A cervical screen test / smear test - is a method of detecting abnormal cells on the cervix. The cervix is the entrance to the womb from the vagina. Detecting and removing abnormal cervical cells can prevent cervical cancer.

attributes.action: Enforce a minimum of 6 weeks Statutory Paternity Leave to all fathers at 90% pay
attributes.background: Fathers currently take 2 weeks paternity leave when their child is born. Mothers are entitled to 52 weeks (39 weeks paid Statutory). Fathers should spend the first 6 weeks with their babies & partners for support & bonding. Paternity leave should change to minimum 6 weeks at 90% of their salary.

attributes.action: Stop companies touting tickets for huge profits & stopping fans going to events
attributes.background: Companies like 'Get Me In' & 'Stubhub' allow tickets to be resold for insane prices. In some instances, they are on these sites before fans even get the chance to buy them. I propose that touting sites have a maximum of a 5% mark up so as to allow fans to go to events without being extorted!
attributes.additional_details: 09.09.16 - Tickets for both UFC and even Green Day appeared almost staright after general sale 'selling out' for double the value of the actual ticket. In the cae of UFC tickets, they were appearing on 'Get Me In' within 2 minutes of the general sale beginning.

attributes.action: Require packaging to state that a product has been tested on animals
attributes.background: We are petitioning for products to advertise their use or lack of cruelty-free testing as a requirement. This allows buyers to make an informed decision on products and their ethics.
attributes.additional_details: Over 3 million animals are tested on each year and many of these tests are unnecessary. The bulk of testing can be carried out digitally and therefore this cruelty to animals is unneeded.

attributes.action: Give free public transport to homeless people in UK
attributes.background: Whilst we find ways and seek solutions to Homelessness it would be a good start by offering access to public transport. This way we would offer them some respite and support that they need in order to improve their lives. Moreover, it would not cost us much as it is already there.
attributes.additional_details:
In the current climate Homelessness is rising and there are no easy solutions to this. Local Authorities are struggling to cope with the demand and are not able to house most people registered as Homeless due to the lack of Housing supply.

We believe that it would be only just fair that as a great country, United Kingdom would allow anyone who is registered as Homeless to have free public transport. This would enable them to go to work, attend job centres, hospital or housing appointments.

attributes.action: No discrimination towards naturists and to gain our equal human rights.
attributes.background: We shouldn’t have to be restricted to designated areas and zones for the simple fact of being unclothed. It is a violation to human rights to take away a simple innocent freedom. The public need to understand that naturism is simply innocent, natural living and freedom. We need our equal rights.
attributes.additional_details: Recently it has also proven that people are more happier when in their natural state which I can solemnly declare and thousands of other naturists can too. We need more urban naturist areas. The time for change is now. Check out this recent link for more details about how being nude can make you a better and happier person. http://www.bn.org.uk/news/information/about-bn/science-proves-naturism-is-good-for-you-r396/

attributes.action: Abolish the Human Rights Act.
attributes.background: We believe that the Human Rights Act should be abolished.  For too long, it has been used as a criminals charter to escape justice and deportation by using the right to family life.  It is high time the Government acted and abolished this pernicious Act.

attributes.action: Halt Brexit process & seek legally binding mandate from public post-Trump
attributes.background: The recent change in the US government administration and their subsequent rhetoric and actions have placed the UK in a perilous negotiating position during the Brexit process. Reality of Brexit is also more well defined than pre-referendum meaning public opinion may have changed significantly.
attributes.additional_details: Following the election of Mr. Trump and the subsequent change in US government administration, the US has changed position on numerous issues, with controversy following certain actions too numerous to mention here. We are specifically concerned with where this leaves the UK in our Brexit negotiations given HM Government's timetable for withdrawal, in light of the overwhelming disquiet shown over aligning ourselves with the new US administration against the relative stability of EU membership.

attributes.action: Ban fireworks outside of events on specific days across the UK.
attributes.background:
In the weeks around Bonfire Night, fireworks are constantly being let off causing nothing but worry for pet owners. 

The noise and vibrations from fireworks can cause severe distress in both wild and domestic animals, meaning that owners have to take steps to alleviate their distress.
attributes.additional_details:
Bonfire 'Night' is often spread over a fortnight. This means that owners can find it difficult to plan for their animals. Fireworks have caused distress to all kinds of animals, not just cats and dogs. Smaller animals, such as rabbits, and farm animals, such as horses, can be affected too. 

This petition is calling for the government to specify days of the year on which the use of fireworks is legal, e.g. 5th November, 31st December, Diwali, and to ban their use outside of these dates.

attributes.action: Ensure that students from year7 are taught in schools how to detect child abuse.
attributes.background: We're a group of students that believe that child abuse needs to be reduced. We have found astonishing figures that kids 4 years old and under are most affected. Most kids that have been physically, verbally or sexually abused are unaware that they are being abused as they don't understand the signs
attributes.additional_details:
Approximately 5 children die every day because of child abuse and 1 out of 3 girls and 1 out of 5 boys will be sexually abused before they reach age 18.
For every child identified as needing protection from abuse, another 8 are suffering alone

attributes.action: Ensure plastic food packaging, plates and cutlery are environmentally friendly.
attributes.background:
France has passed a new law to ensure all plastic cups, cutlery and plates are compostable and made of biologically-sourced materials.
The UK should be making plans to implement similar plastics and packaging controls in order to tackle the growing problems of pollution and climate change.
attributes.additional_details:
By 2050 there will be more plastic in our oceans than fish (World Economic Forum). Nearly a third of all plastics leak into the environment where they end up eaten by wildlife or in floating rubbish dumps in the sea.
The British government needs to take some kind of definitive action against the use of plastics in our country, if we’re going to have any chance of mitigating the problem of waste in a growing global population.
